description:
This PR has some dramatic speedup improvements for `photon_simulator`, as well as adding a couple new options and fixing a corner-case bug. 

1) The `ThermalPhotonModel` class, which is the main way to generate photons, has gained significant speedups.   
2) Fixed a bug in `prepare_photons` where the angular diameter distance units were not being set correctly.   
3) One can now bin a spectrum on user-defined channels, even if a response has not been provided. This allows one to fit the spectrum in XSPEC with a "dummy" identity matrix response.    
4) The "normal" parameter now takes "x", "y", or "z", to project simply along one of the domain axes. Should result in some minor speedups for these cases.    
5) `ThermalPhotonModel` now has a "method" keyword argument which controls how the photon energies are generated from the spectrum from one of two methods.     
6) Made a minor internal change to `spectral_models` to get around some odd behavior in XSPEC when using it to generate photons.    
7) General code cleanup.    

I updated the `photon_simulator` docs to reflect the public-facing changes.
title: Speedups and improvements for photon_simulator

The format I used for doing this (here taken from line 422 of visualization/plot_modifications.py):

```
#!python


        if label_args is not None:
            text_args = label_args
            warnings.warn("The label_args keyword is deprecated.  Please use "
                          "the text_args keyword instead.")
```
